name: KLM 777-306ER [PH-BVN] Close Up Taxi and Takeoff from Calgary Airport
description:
Another clip from back in the summer! Here we have KLM's largest twinjet taxiing up close and departing 17L from Zulu, one of the intersections that's normally used by regional aircraft, located about 4,000 feet down the runway. Granted, that still leaves 10,000 for this big bird, which is still more than enough, but it's not often that you see a 777-300ER take an intersection for departure here in Calgary! Enjoy this close up footage with ATC.

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFO
Airline: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines (KLM/KL)
Aircraft: Boeing 777-300ER (B77W)
Aircraft Name: "Tijuca National Park"
Livery: Revised (2015)
Engines: 2x GE90-115B
Registration: PH-BVN
Route: Calgary (YYC) - Amsterdam-Schiphol (AMS)
Callsign: KLM 678 heavy
Runway used: 17L shortened
Date filmed: September 1, 2017
Local time: 1530
FlightAware: http://flightaware.com/live/flight/PHBVN
